results.brief_description: Planning, planting, cultivating, and harvesting a market garden in the United States, with emphasis on pest and weed control. Narrated by Bill Jefferay.

results.title: The Farm factory
results.brief_description: How the work of a typical British farm is organised, how the yearly production schedule, the marketing of the farm products, and the daily life and work in a rural community is carried out. Commentary by John Morgan.

results.title: The Farm
results.creator_credit: Bill Hughes, Burberry Productions, ABC-TV (Australia) and Kate Woods
results.brief_description: Miniseries about the harsh realities of farming in Australia during the 1980s and one family’s battle against economic and climatic odds. It is 1985 and prolonged drought and high interest rates have meant that sheep farmers Tom and Liz Cooper (Colin Friels and Greta Scacchi) can no longer meet the repayments on their foreign currency loan. The bank threatens to foreclose and the couple decides to sue them to save their property. It’s a seven-year battle that tests the family’s fortitude against the bank’s corporate might. Filmed on location in the sheep country near Yass, “The Farm” tackles issues which are still relevant to farmers today such as farm succession, economic rationalism, corporatisation and the perceived uncaring nature of government policy.

results.title: The Family: the boy who lived alone
results.brief_description: A young boy, Billy, runs away from home. As he walks, he observes others who appear lonesome. The film captures many of the thoughts Billy has about his family. After a wet, uncomfortable night in an abandoned house, Billy’s desire to become part of his family again increases and he decides to return home at daybreak.

results.title: The Family: life styles of the future (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Hobel-Leiterman Productions, Document Associates, Philip S. Hobel, Douglas Leiterman and Beryl Fox
results.brief_description: Dr. Margaret Meade, considers the concept of the family. Whilst the nuclear family has predominated in industrial societies, Dr. Meade highlights current developments, including the communal family and the “three-way marriage”. She then progresses into a discussion on the factors that will influence the composition of the family of the future.

results.title: The Family: an approach to peace
results.brief_description: Shows that the only way to peace is in the understanding of other peoples, and contrasts the popular conception of foreign lands with life as it actually is around the globe. Through scenes of everyday family life everywhere, describes the similarity of the fears and aspirations of all people.

results.title: The Family of man. Part 3. Weddings (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Part three of the series, “The Family of Man” which sets out to compare family life in five different locations around the world. A comparison of weddings, the differences and similarities these rituals have in different societies are studied. There is also an investigation into some of the mysteries surrounding weddings in England - what the ring, veil, bouquet and wedding cake signify. By looking at weddings in other countries it is possible to make some shrewd guesses.

results.title: The Family
results.creator_credit: Herbert Kerkow and United States. Army
results.brief_description: Family life as lived by a father, mother, two children and a grandmother is depicted. They are not in affluent circumstances and conflicts arise because the father wants to repair the house, mother wants a sewing machine, and the daughter a ball dress. They get together and talk out their problems; by so doing they strengthen the bonds of family life and create a sense of security among themselves.

results.title: The Fallout atom
results.creator_credit: Michael Sklar, Columbia Broadcasting System and Harold Mayer
results.brief_description: An examination of the scientific facts of human radiation filmed at the Argonne National Laboratory of the AEC in Lemont, Ill. Dr John E. Rose attempts to find out how much radioactive material the human body possesses naturally, how much we have been exposed to as a result of nuclear bomb tests, and the effects of radiation on health and life. Shows the tests of two groups of human guinea pigs; one group - radium dial painters who literally ate radium 30 years ago, and another group whose everyday drinking water has a higher-than-average percentage of radium.

results.title: The Fallen idol [study extract]
results.brief_description: The excerpt covers the following: Baines, Julie and Felipe and a day of stolen happiness with a riotous game of hide and seek in the empty Embassy, not knowing that Mrs Baines is spying on them. Felipe is awakened later by Mrs Baines who tries to involve him in her plot against her husband. The terrified boy witnesses a violent struggling quarrel between husband and wife, and believes that Baines has killed his wife. He rushes into the night in his pyjamas but is apprehended and taken in charge by a friendly policeman. The extract is chosen to illustrate Reed’s style, his ability to handle actors, (especially the child), the use of a large number of shots and quick cutting back and forth, imaginative lighting and the creation of suspense.
